"Look, Mommy!" she said. "My candy is so yellow and shiny now!" 
Mommy smiled.
"That's wonderful sweetheart," she said. "Now, why don't you go outside and enjoy it with your friends?" 
The little girl took the candy and skipped outside. She had no idea that the candy would make her friends so happy. But Mommy had a plan. She knew that when the little girl shared the candy, it would bring everyone joy.

One day, a boy named Tim went to ride his bike. He saw

, the boy had a large bag in his hands. 
The old man quickly ran over to the spot and grabbed the bag. Inside was a razor! 
He looked at the boy and said sternly, "I told you I don't have anything available. Now why don't you behave yourself and go home?" The young boy realized his mistake and ran away.
The old man shook his head and thought to himself, 'It's important to be a good role model so that others will behave too'. He was glad he could prevent something bad from happening by setting a good example.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Tom. Tom liked to sleep all day and play all night. He lived in a small house with a girl named Lucy.
One sunny day, Lucy wanted to make a cake. She asked Tom, "Will you help me make the cake?" Tom looked at her and said, "Okay, but only if I can sleep after." Lucy agreed and they started to make the cake.
Lucy needed a teaspoon to measure the sugar. She looked everywhere but could not find it.

Molly spotted something shiny in the grass. She bent down and pulled it out. It was a spade! The spade was shiny and silver, and had a yellow handle. Molly and Julia were amazed.
Molly and Julia started to use the spade to dig. They dug and dug until their arms were tired. Suddenly, something special appeared. It was a treasure chest! Molly and Julia looked at each other with excitement.
Molly opened the chest, and inside it was a beautiful necklace. The necklace had shimmering emeralds, and it was so amazing! Molly and Julia hugged each other

with glee.
Suddenly, she heard a voice behind her. It was her dad. "Be careful around the crocodile, Daisy," he said. "It could hurt you if you get too close."
Daisy nodded and stepped away from the water. She realised that it was important to be independent and explore, but also stay safe.
From that day on, Daisy was always careful when looking around and exploring. She knew that there were exciting things to discover but also to be wary of danger.

The desk was covered in presents. Sarah was so excited that she wanted to open them all at once.
"No, Sarah," said Mum calmly. "You can only open one at a time!"
Sarah wanted to open all of them, but she remembered what Mum said and tried to be calm. Slowly, She opened each present one by one. It felt like it took forever. 
In the end, Sarah was so happy with all the surprises she had received. And when Sarah was finished, the desk was covered up with all the presents again.

was making sauce in his kitchen. Suddenly, his three-year old grandchild burst into the kitchen.

Suddenly he heard a voice. It was a little girl. She was pointing to the thread in Jim's hand and said "Mine!"
Jim was surprised and said "What is it?"
The little girl replied "My thread, it's my thread!"
Jim smiled and said "Do you want it back? You can have it if you like."
The little girl was delighted and said "Yes please!"
Jim handed her the thread and she ran away happily. Jim laughed and continued jogging.

of things. 
Then his sister Jane came into the room with her pet cat. She was carrying a flute in her hand. 
Tom stopped painting and watched Jane play the flute. The sound of the flute was very noisy but it made the room feel very special.
Tom liked the sound and he grabbed his paintbrush. He started to paint the noise. He painted flashes of orange, pink and red that swirled around the room.
It looked really beautiful when Tom was done. His family applauded him, and Tom was proud of his painting.

The boys were excited and started to take the things out. Suddenly, a man appeared behind them. He was very angry and yelled at the boys. He told them that the box belonged to his shop and that they had to put everything back. 
The boys tried to explain that they were only curious and wanted to support the shop but the man did not listen. He simply took the box away and told them to stay away from the shop.
The boys felt sad and scared and quickly ran back to their room. From that day, they realised the importance of asking for help and support before doing anything.
